H0.text: where did the ancestors of the domestic goat originate. Turkey

H1.text: where did the ancestors of the domestic goat originate. Pakistan

H2.text: where did the ancestors of the domestic goat originate. Mongolia

H3.text: where did the ancestors of the domestic goat originate. Iran

A4.text: The earliest remnants of domesticated goats dating 10,000 years Before Present are found in Ganj Dareh in Iran.

A5.text: The wild bezoar ibex, found today in the Zagros Mountains, but formerly widespread in Anatolia, is the likely original ancestor of all or most domestic goats today.

A6.text: The goat or domestic goat (Capra hircus) is a species of goat-antelope that is mostly kept as livestock. It was domesticated from the wild goat (C. aegagrus) of Southwest Asia and Eastern Europe.

A7.text: Goat remains have been found at archaeological sites in Jericho, Choga Mami, Djeitun, and Çayönü, dating the domestication of goats in Western Asia at between 8,000 and 9,000 years ago.
